source_sentence: 佛說申日經(開元錄中無法護譯，恐是支謙誤為法護)西晉月氏三藏竺法護譯聞如是：一時，佛遊王舍城靈鳥頂山，與大比丘千二百五十人。
translation: The Foshuo shengri jing (a translation of the Kaiyuan lu that could not be translated by Hao, probably because Zhi Qian mistook it for Fa Hao) was translated and heard by Zhu Fa Hao, the Yuezhi trident of the Western Jin dynasty, as follows: One time, the Buddha traveled to the city of Rājagṛha on Vulture Peak with twelve hundred and fifty great monks.

source_sentence: 爾時，王舍城中有大豪富長者，名旃羅日，財寶無量，敬信佛法、供養眾僧，精進難及。
translation: At the time, there was a great wealthy elder in Rājagṛha named Kālôdayin, who had measureless possessions, revered the Buddha's teachings, made offerings to the saṃgha, and made efforts that were difficult to match.

source_sentence: 長者有弟號名申日，不信佛法奉諸邪術，見兄奉正每懷恚嫉，所可侍師號不蘭迦葉。
translation: The elder had a younger brother named Shenri who didn't believe in the Buddha's teaching and espoused mistaken beliefs, was always hostile and jealous when he saw his brother serving the right, and was called Pūraṇa-kāśyapa as his mentor.

source_sentence: 不蘭迦葉五百人等，謂申日言：「今汝兄者獨不侍我，不知真道而反信佛。」
translation: Five hundred of them, including Pūraṇa-kāśyapa, said to Shensānī, "Now, your brother alone doesn't serve me, and he doesn't know the true way but believes in the Buddha instead."

source_sentence: 時，旃羅日知異道人所共論說，語申日言：「吾明日欲請卿師，寧肯自屈詣吾舍不？」
translation: Knowing what the heretics were saying, Kālāśinī said to Shensānī, "Tomorrow, I'd like to invite you to be my teacher; would you rather submit yourself to my home?"

source_sentence: 申日答言：「當往報之。」
translation: Shenmitsu replied, "I will go to him in retaliation."

source_sentence: 申日即往詣其師所，長跪白言：「我兄今欲降伏請諸大人，明日自屈詣其舍食。」
translation: Shenmitsu then went to his teacher, knelt down, and said, "Now, my brother wants to subdue you, so he'll go to his house tomorrow and eat."

source_sentence: 師言：「大善！
translation: The master said, "Very good!

source_sentence: 即受其請。」
translation: He then accepted his invitation."

source_sentence: 時申日還白其兄言：「今已受請，明日當來。」
translation: Śrī Siṃdha then returned to his brother and said, "Now that I've accepted your invitation, I'll come tomorrow."

source_sentence: 時旃羅日多使人客，於門中地掘作大坑令深五尺，以青污泥滿其坑中，薄覆其上令如平地；又復豫作五百發脚床，皆施一脚以襜衣之，以五百鉢成熟乳酪，以此供具待異道人。
translation: Kālāśyapa then had his guests dig a large pit five feet deep in the ground at the entrance, fill it with green sludge, and cover it with a thin layer so that it looked like level ground.

source_sentence: 明日時至，來詣請所，諸尼犍子無有法則，亂行併肩先入無上，適至門中皆各使走，却墮泥坑污其衣服，皆悉瞋恚各欲還去。
translation: When they arrived tomorrow morning, they were invited to the monastery, and the naked mendicants, who had no rule of law and had gone into the unsurpassed place with their shoulders together in disorder, each made to leave when they arrived at the gate and fell into a mudhole that soiled their robes, so they were all angry and wanted to return.

source_sentence: 時旃羅日使人牽留，解語其意：「此舊泥坑，道人不知而墮此坑，不故為之，幸莫瞋恚，願前飯食。」
translation: Kālāśyapa sent someone to take them back and explain their intentions, "This is an old mud pit; the wayfarers didn't know about it and fell into it.

source_sentence: 貿易衣服，盡請令入。
translation: He gathered his clothes and invited them all to enter.

source_sentence: 在門裏徑先付酪器，皆手持已，便語令坐，適却居床，床皆反側，五百道人皆僵仆地，鉢酪漿者，激灌其面及其衣服。
translation: After they had each handed a container of milk, they were told to sit down, and when the beds were turned upside down, all five hundred of them fell to the ground, and the bowl of milk was poured over their faces and robes.

source_sentence: 時諸道人益懷瞋恚，語申日言：「汝今投我與兄共謀，毀辱吾等，甚為不細。」
translation: The five hundred wayfarers then became increasingly angry and said to Śāriputra, "Now, you've cast us into the company of your brother, and you've dishonored us; how dare you?"

source_sentence: 是時，申日亦大不樂，道人瞋恚皆棄捨去。
translation: Shenmitsu also became very unhappy, and the wayfarers all abandoned him in anger.

source_sentence: 時旃羅日復牽留之，為說方便譬喻之言：「屬卿曹等墮泥中時，身體正黑甚為醜惡，如卿之道；今酪正白其色鮮潔，譬如佛道，亦可捨卿所奉之術來就吾法。」
translation: Kālāśinī again took them back and explained a convenient metaphor, saying, "When you fell into the mud, your bodies were black and ugly, just like your path; now, your cheese is white and your skin is clean, just like the Buddha's path, so you can abandon the techniques you've been taught and come to my teaching."

source_sentence: 諸異道人不復與語，懷恚而去。
translation: The heretics stopped talking to him and departed, harboring resentment.

source_sentence: 明日申日往詣師所，長跪自陳：「我兄無狀所為非法，我實不知，願師加哀不見咎責。
translation: On the morrow, they went to the master's office on the next day and knelt down long enough to tell him, "My brother did something without form that was really unlawful, and I really didn't know about it.

source_sentence: 雖爾，今者當為大師報昨日之怨。
translation: Even so, I will now repay yesterday's enmity for the teacher.

source_sentence: 我兄但以泥坑酪漿，毀辱師等耳，我今所報當過於此。
translation: My brother only dishonored our teacher with a pit of mud and milk, but my retribution now will be greater than that.

source_sentence: 今我兄所侍之師，我當請之，掘門裏地令入五丈，以火著中薄覆其上，設眾飯食皆內毒藥。
translation: Now, I'll invite the teacher my brother serves to dig a hole in the ground five feet inside the entrance, cover it with a thin layer of fire, and prepare a meal that's poisoned inside.

source_sentence: 時佛當來，若不墮火坑中者，當持毒飯而分布，與以此殺之，於師何如？」
translation: When the Buddha comes, if he doesn't fall into the fiery pit, he'll distribute the poisoned rice and kill them with it.

source_sentence: 時師報言：「如佛世尊，多智聖猛覩去來事，他人所議輒豫知之，卿雖欲爾恐不能諧。」
translation: The teacher then reported, "Just like the Bhagavān, the sage of much wisdom sees things in the past and future with fierce determination, and he readily understands what others say, even though you want to, I'm afraid you won't be able to get along with it."

source_sentence: 申日復言：「先當請之，若其受者為無所知，若必明聖不受吾請。」
translation: He also said, "First, you must ask them, but if they accept it, they'll be ignorant; if they're certainly intelligent and noble, they won't accept my invitation."

source_sentence: 師曰：「大善！」
translation: The teacher said, "Great!"

source_sentence: 是時，申日出王舍城詣靈鳥山，前到佛所，叉手揖讓，而白佛言：「我欲請佛及諸弟子，願屈光儀到舍小飯。」
translation: At the time, Shen Sun rose from Rājagṛha and went up to Vulture Peak, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said to him, "I'd like to invite the Buddha and his disciples to come to Śākyamuni with polite deportment for a small meal."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大善！」
translation: The Buddha said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 於是申日歡喜而退，還白其師：「佛已受請為無所知，但當掘坑具毒飯耳。」
translation: She rejoiced and withdrew, then returned to her teacher and said, "I don't know that the Buddha has accepted my invitation, but I will dig a pit and prepare poisoned rice."

source_sentence: 時諸異道人皆大踊躍，展轉相謂以為大慶。
translation: The heretics then all rejoiced greatly, and they all said to each other in turn, 'This is great rejoicing.'

source_sentence: 申日有子，名旃羅法(漢言月光童子)，先世宿命學佛經道，有神猛志，志在大乘，白其父言：「佛者大聖神通已達，前知無窮却覩無極，蜎蜚蠕動心義所念，皆豫知之。
translation: A son of Śāriputra named Cālafar (the Han word for child of moonlight), who had been born in a prior life and had studied the scriptures and path of the Buddha, had a vigorous determination and aspirations for the great vehicle, and said to his father, "That Buddha has attained the great sage's supernormal powers, has known infinity and yet has seen infinity, and he's always aware of the thoughts of larvae and wriggling minds.

source_sentence: 莫用邪冥惡人之言，受其重罪。」
translation: Don't use the words of a wrong or evil person and accept their grave offense."

source_sentence: 時，旃羅法復白父言：「假令劫盡滿其中火，三千剎土皆悉周遍，又取諸毒揣若須彌，猶尚不能動佛一毛，況此小坑而欲害之。
translation: Cālafar then again said to his father, "Suppose an eon were to be completely filled with its fire, and the 3,000 buddha-lands were all covered, and he were to take poisonous pellets like Sumeru, which still couldn't touch a hair on the Buddha's head, so he wouldn't want to harm him in this small pit.

source_sentence: 今父所作譬如螢火，自以小明欲蔽日月，譬如小鳥欲以其身衝崩鐵圍，反碎其身無所能諧。
translation: What our father does is like a firefly that wants to blind the sun and moon with its own small light, or like a small bird that wants to smash its body against an iron ring but finds nothing to harmonize with its broken body.

source_sentence: 今諸異道所作如是，不須請佛。」
translation: Such are the actions of these heretics, so there's no need to invite the Buddha."

source_sentence: 其父不信故如前謀，明日時至遣人白佛：「所供已辦，願可自屈。」
translation: His father didn't believe him and therefore continued as before, but on the morrow he sent someone to tell the Buddha, "Now that I've made my offerings, I wish I could submit myself."

source_sentence: 於是如來便起向道，放大光明一切洞徹。
translation: The Tathāgata then arose and headed for the path, radiating his radiance and penetrating everything.

source_sentence: 是時，十方有十菩薩皆阿惟顏，一一菩薩各與億百那術無數菩薩俱飛來會，各將寶華栴檀名香，以眾伎樂供養世尊，詣王舍城，欲觀如來有所感動。
translation: At the time, ten bodhisattvas in ten directions, each with a hundred million and one incalculable bodhisattvas, flew to meet with the Bhagavān, each bringing jewels, flowers, sandalwood, and famous incense, and each offering the Bhagavān with a variety of music and tricks, and went to Rājagṛha to see how the Tathāgata had moved them.

source_sentence: 時申日舍，有金色光皆明如日，旃羅法白言：「今佛現舍金色之光，佛以向道有此感應，可往止之，不須使前。」
translation: When there was a golden light shining like the sun in the Śrīvastī building, Cāḷanafar said, "Now that the Buddha is giving away golden light, the Buddha is making this inspiration for his path, so you can go and stop him; there's no need to make him go."

source_sentence: 父故不信。
translation: The father therefore didn't believe him.

source_sentence: 是時，申日第一夫人號名月羽，旃羅法母也，見此變瑞踊躍歡喜，即發無上正真道意。
translation: The Śrī Siṃhasvara first wife, who was named Yuehasvara and was Chandrāpta's mother, then saw this miraculous transformation, jumped up and rejoiced, and immediately aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 於是，旃羅法白其母言：「今當勅五百夫人，皆令莊嚴出見如來。
translation: Candra Dharma then said to his mother, "Now, I will order 500 wives to adorn themselves and appear before the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊難值，億百千劫時有佛耳。」
translation: The Bhagavān is difficult to attain, for there are billions and billions of eons when there's a Buddha."

source_sentence: 五百夫人皆悉受教，歡喜侍佛。
translation: The five hundred wives were all instructed and rejoiced to serve the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛入城時，足蹈門閫，三千國土皆大震動，諸有疾病悉為除愈，盲視聾聽瘖痾能言，跛躃者行，諸被毒者毒皆不行。
translation: When the Buddha entered the city, his feet trembled at the gates, and 3,000 lands were shaken so violently that they were all cured of illness, blindness, deafness, hearing, deafness, the ability to speak with outpatients, lameness, and lack of ability to walk, and the inability to treat people with poison.

source_sentence: 諸有樂器不鼓自鳴，金銀、七寶皆作音聲，飛鳥、走獸相和悲鳴。
translation: Instruments that exist without drums sound on their own, gold, silver, and seven treasures all make sounds, and birds and animals sing in unison with each other in sympathy.

source_sentence: 時十方神并諸天人，各與尊神不可計數，皆悉隨從詣申日舍。
translation: The gods of the ten directions and the gods and goddesses of incalculable dignity all followed him to Śānsīya.

source_sentence: 佛蹈火坑變為浴池，中生蓮華大如車輪，華有千葉七寶為莖，其色妙好佛蹈其上，及諸菩薩所可蹈華，皆生五百葉，弟子乘者華生五百葉。
translation: The Buddha plunged into the fiery pit and was transformed into a bathing pond, in which there grew a lotus flower as large as a chariot wheel with a thousand leaves and a stem made of seven jewels, whose color was marvelous.

source_sentence: 申日見火坑作此變化，心中驚悴即大惶怖，頭面作禮。
translation: When Shen Ri saw this transformation in the fire pit, he was terrified and terrified at heart, and he bowed with his head and face.

source_sentence: 佛入其舍，菩薩弟子皆悉坐定，申日懺悔，前白佛言：「我大無狀所作非法，今飯食中皆有毒藥，乞得更備辦，宿留須臾。」
translation: When the Buddha entered his abode, the disciples of the bodhisattva were all sitting in meditation. Shenmitsu repented and said to the Buddha, "I've done something illegal, and now there's poison and medicine in my food.

source_sentence: 佛言：「持毒飯來，我自食之。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Bring me the poisoned rice, and I'll eat it myself."

source_sentence: 申日歡喜即如佛教，分布飯具皆悉周遍，便即受之呪願達嚫。
translation: Shenmitsu rejoiced and thus became like a Buddhist, distributing the meal thoroughly and accepting it immediately with a dhāraṇī of vows.

source_sentence: 其毒飯者變為百味，香聞十方，其有聞此飯香氣者，自然飽滿身得安隱，皆發無上平等道意。
translation: The poisoned rice becomes a hundred flavors and its fragrance is heard in ten directions, and anyone who hears the fragrance of this rice is naturally satisfied and attains peace, and they all arouse the intention for the unsurpassed and equal path.

source_sentence: 飯食畢竟，五百夫人及旃羅法為佛作禮，却住一面，長者申日自取小床於佛前坐，而白佛言：「世尊神通有三達智，我之所作想佛已了，不即逆告語我，乃令吾等興立非法造此惡事，佛豈不知我所議耶？」
translation: When the meal was finished, the five hundred wives and the Śāla Padma paid homage to the Buddha and withdrew to one side. The elder Śāriputra took his own cot and sat down in front of the Buddha, saying to him, "The Bhagavān has the supernormal power and the three supernormal powers to understand what I've done.

source_sentence: 佛告申日：「乃昔過去阿僧祇劫，爾時有佛號提和竭如來，為等正覺，其明無量度諸懈廢，與眾開士及大弟子無央數俱行入城。
translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, "Once upon a time, there was a Buddha named Dhṛtarāṣṭra who was a perfectly enlightened one, whose insight was unmatched by all kinds of laziness, and who marched into the city with an incalculable number of laymen and great disciples.

source_sentence: 時有長者名鞞陀衛，時適出城，有梵志女，鮮潔少雙，執持名華。
translation: An elder named Vaidehī was leaving the city at the right time, and there was a priestess, fresh and young, holding a name and flowers.

source_sentence: 時長者子即以銀錢五百，從賣華女得華五莖，以散佛上。
translation: The elder's son then gave 500 coins of silver and got five stalks of flowers from the flower seller and scattered them on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛即授其決言：『汝却後無數阿僧祇劫，當得作佛號釋迦文。
translation: The Buddha then gave him a verdict, saying, 'In the countless incalculable eons to come, you will become a buddha named Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 汝作佛時，當有長者號名申日，與異道人合構逆事，火坑、毒飯規欲試汝。
translation: When you become a buddha, there will be an elder named Śāriputra who will team up with someone from another religion to do something bad, such as testing you in a fire pit or with a plan to cook poisoned rice.

source_sentence: 雖有此惡，當因汝得度。』」
translation: Even though this evil exists, you will be saved because of it.'"

source_sentence: 佛告申日：「時長者子今我身是，我乃爾時從如來授記，即得明決之定，以為悉豫知有汝名字，況汝昨日所謀議事，豈不知乎？
translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, "The elder son was now me, and I had then been given a prediction by the Tathāgata that I would attain a resolute concentration in order to fully know that your name existed, so why wouldn't you not know what you were planning to do yesterday?

source_sentence: 當知諸佛善權之慧，欲以因緣有所起發。」
translation: You should know that the wisdom of the buddhas' good authority wants to give rise to causes and conditions."

source_sentence: 長者申日聞佛所說即得法忍，復自歎言：「如來之智無所不度，明知我今不復受罪。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, the elder then attained patience with the Dharma and praised himself, saying, "There's nothing the Tathāgata's wisdom can't save, and he knows full well that I won't be subject to another sin now.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 過去世時錠光如來豫說我名，今當為佛之所開化，以是言之不復受罪。」
translation: In a past life, the Dīpaṃkara Tathāgata repeatedly spoke my name, and now I will be enlightened by the Buddha, so I won't be condemned again for saying so."

source_sentence: 時佛說法於王舍城，長者居士無央數千，及異道人五百之眾，皆發無上正真道意。
translation: When the Buddha preached in the city of Rājagṛha, an incalculably large crowd of thousands of elders and householders and 500 people of another path all aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 五百夫人即時逮得不退轉地。
translation: Five hundred wives immediately attained the stage of irreversibility.

source_sentence: 月光童子從坐而起，讚歎佛已，而白佛言：「設我來世得作佛時，令我國土一切人民無有惡心皆應質朴，有諸惡國人民剛強五濁賤世，我願於中而開化之。」
translation: After rising from his seat and praising the Buddha, the Candraprabha boy said to the Buddha, "Suppose I were to become a buddha in a future life and cause all the people of my land to be simple without evil intentions, or there are bad countries whose people are rigid and whose world is five times less turbid, and I would like to enlighten them in those countries."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「汝聞月光童子所說不乎？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Have you heard what the Boy Candraprabha said?"

source_sentence: 阿難對曰：「唯然已聞。」
translation: Ānanda replied, "Yes, I've heard it."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「我般涅槃千歲已後，經法且欲斷絕，月光童子當出於秦國作聖君，持我經法興隆道化。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "After a thousand years of parinirvāṇa and when the sūtras and teachings are about to be cut off, Boy Moonlight will go out to Qin and become a sage ruler who will carry my sūtras and teachings and make the Way flourish.

source_sentence: 秦土及諸邊國，鄯善、烏長、歸茲、疏勒、大宛、于填，及諸羌虜夷狄，皆當奉佛尊法，普作比丘。
translation: The land of Qin and the neighboring countries of Shanshan, Udyāna, Qizi, Shule, Dāwan, Yuyan, and the Qiang people and barbarians will all honor the Buddha's teaching and become monks.

source_sentence: 其有一切男子、女人，聞申日經，前所作犯惡逆者皆得除盡。
translation: All those men and women who hear the Shenmri Sutra will have their prior misdeeds and transgressions removed.

source_sentence: 當知世尊之所應度如是如是，其有犯逆尚得度脫，何況至心學佛道者。」
translation: You should know that the Bhagavān's deliverance is thus and so forth, and it's possible to liberate someone who has committed a transgression, let alone someone who's dedicated to training in the Buddha Way."

source_sentence: 佛說經已，一切眾會莫不歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke the sūtra, everyone in the congregation rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 佛說申日經
translation: Foshuo shengri jing

source_sentence: 按《開元錄》，此經四譯一失，法護譯中雖有《月光童子經》，亦名《申日經》者，自是一經有二名耳，非別有《申日經》是法護譯者。
translation: According to the Kaiyuan lu, one of the four translations of this sūtra was lost, and although there is a translation of the Sutra of the Boy Yuehwang that is also called the Shenri jing, it is because there are two names for one sūtra, not because there is a separate translation of the Shenri jing by Hōshi.

source_sentence: 藏中既有《月光童子經》，為法護譯，斯已矣！
translation: There is already a translation of the Sutra of the Boy Candraprabha in the canon for Hōshū, and that's enough!

source_sentence: 此何更有《申日經》為法護之譯耶？
translation: Why is there another translation of the Shenli jing for Hōshū?

source_sentence: 則未知此經是誰之譯？
translation: Then I wonder whose translation of this sūtra was made?

source_sentence: 又何據謂之法護譯耶？
translation: What is the basis for calling this a translation of the Dharma Protector?

source_sentence: 今以錄中有云：「支謙譯中有《申日經》一卷，云與《月光童子經》同本異譯。
translation: Now, there's a statement in the records that says, "In Zhi Qian's translation, there's a volume of the Shenri jing, which he says is a variant translation of the same text as the Yueguang dongzi jing.

source_sentence: 今撿尋文句，二經不殊，故不雙出云云。」
translation: Now, when we examine the text, we see that the two scriptures are not different, so they don't both appear."

source_sentence: 則藏中必有支謙所譯《月光童子經》，亦名《申日經》者。
translation: Then there must be a translation of the Sutra of the Boy Candraprabha by Zhi Qian, which is also called the Sutra of the Deathbed Injunction.

source_sentence: 今諸藏皆無，恐此經即是，而誤安法護之名耳。
translation: It's probably because it's not found in any of the canons now, and it was mistakenly called the Sutra of the Deathbed Injunction.

source_sentence: 如是，則四譯還具矣。
translation: If that's the case, then the four translations are still complete.

source_sentence: 冐陳瞽言，以俟來哲。
translation: I'll leave it to future philosophers to present the googly-eyed words.
